name: Animation
comment:
Stores multiple images, most oftenly as the frames of an animation.

Some formats, such as image/image.TiffDecoder, support multiple images that are not to be interpreted as animation, but rather multiple pages of a document. The image/image.Animation container is still used to store the images for these files. The image/image.Animation.frameType property is used to differentiate multi-page documents from multi-frame animations, where it is set to image/image.Animation.PAGE for documents and image/image.Animation.ANIMATION for animated frames.

All image/image.Decoder classes support decoding to an image/image.Animation, where the image/image.Animation will only contain a single frame for single image formats such as JPEG, or if the file doesn't contain any animation such as a single image GIF. If you want to generically support both animated and non-animated files, you can always decode to an animation and if the animation has only a single frame, then it's a non-animated image.

In some cases, the frames of the animation may only provide a portion of the canvas, such as the case of animations encoding only the changing pixels from one frame to the next. The image/image.Animation.width and image/image.Animation.height and image/image.Animation.backgroundColor properties of the image/image.Animation provide information about the canvas that contains the animation, and the image/image.Image frames provide information about how to draw the particular frame, such as the area of the canvas to draw into, and if the canvas should be cleared prior to drawing the frame.

ANIMATION.name: ANIMATION
ANIMATION.comment: The frames of this document are to be interpreted as animation.

PAGE.name: PAGE
PAGE.comment: The frames of this document are to be interpreted as pages of a document.

backgroundColor.name: backgroundColor
backgroundColor.comment: The suggested background color to clear the canvas with.

frameType.name: frameType
frameType.comment: How should the frames be interpreted? If image/image.Animation.ANIMATION, the frames are part of an animated sequence. If image/image.Animation.PAGE, the frames are the pages of a document.

height.name: height
height.comment: The canvas height for containing the animation.

loopCount.name: loopCount
loopCount.comment: How many times should the animation loop (0 means forever)?

width.name: width
width.comment: The canvas width for containing the animation.

isNotEmpty.name: isNotEmpty
isNotEmpty.comment: Returns true if there is at least one frame in the animation.

iterator.name: iterator
iterator.comment: Get the iterator for looping over the animation. This allows the Animation to be used in for-each loops: for (AnimationFrame frame in animation) { ... }

length.name: length
length.comment: How many frames are in the animation?

numFrames.name: numFrames
numFrames.comment: How many frames are in the animation?

first.name: first
first.comment:
Returns the first element.

If this is empty throws a dart-core.StateError. Otherwise this method is equivalent to this.elementAt(0)

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides image/image.Animation.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

isEmpty.name: isEmpty
isEmpty.comment: Returns true if there is no element in this collection.

isNotEmpty.name: isNotEmpty
isNotEmpty.comment: Returns true if there is at least one element in this collection.

iterator.name: iterator
iterator.comment: Returns an Iterator that iterates over this Iterable object.

last.name: last
last.comment:
Returns the last element.

If this is empty throws a dart-core.StateError.

length.name: length
length.comment:
Returns the number of elements in this.

Counting all elements may be involve running through all elements and can therefore be slow.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

single.name: single
single.comment:
Returns the single element in this.

If this is empty or has more than one element throws a dart-core.StateError.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and image/image.Animation.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the image/image.Animation.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

any.name: any
any.comment: Returns true if one element of this collection satisfies the predicate test. Returns false otherwise.

contains.name: contains
contains.comment: Returns true if the collection contains an element equal to image/image.Animation.contains.element.

elementAt.name: elementAt
elementAt.comment:
Returns the image/image.Animation.elementAt.indexth element.

The image/image.Animation.elementAt.index must be non-negative and less than image/image.Animation.length.

Note: if this does not have a deterministic iteration order then the function may simply return any element without any iteration if there are at least image/image.Animation.elementAt.index elements in this.

every.name: every
every.comment: Returns true if every elements of this collection satisify the predicate test. Returns false otherwise.

expand.name: expand
expand.comment:
Expands each element of this dart-core.Iterable into zero or more elements.

The resulting Iterable runs through the elements returned by image/image.Animation.expand.f for each element of this, in order.

The returned dart-core.Iterable is lazy, and calls image/image.Animation.expand.f for each element of this every time it's iterated.

firstWhere.name: firstWhere
firstWhere.comment:
Returns the first element that satisfies the given predicate image/image.Animation.firstWhere.test.

If none matches, the result of invoking the image/image.Animation.firstWhere.orElse function is returned. By default, when image/image.Animation.firstWhere.orElse is null, a dart-core.StateError is thrown.

fold.name: fold
fold.comment:
Reduces a collection to a single value by iteratively combining each element of the collection with an existing value using the provided function.

Use image/image.Animation.fold.initialValue as the initial value, and the function image/image.Animation.fold.combine to create a new value from the previous one and an element.

Example of calculating the sum of an iterable:

iterable.fold(0, (prev, element) => prev + element);

forEach.name: forEach
forEach.comment: Applies the function image/image.Animation.forEach.f to each element of this collection.

join.name: join
join.comment:
Converts each element to a dart-core.String and concatenates the strings.

Converts each element to a dart-core.String by calling image/image.Animation.toString on it. Then concatenates the strings, optionally separated by the image/image.Animation.join.separator string.

lastWhere.name: lastWhere
lastWhere.comment:
Returns the last element that satisfies the given predicate image/image.Animation.lastWhere.test.

If none matches, the result of invoking the image/image.Animation.lastWhere.orElse function is returned. By default, when image/image.Animation.lastWhere.orElse is null, a dart-core.StateError is thrown.

map.name: map
map.comment:
Returns a lazy dart-core.Iterable where each element e of this is replaced by the result of f(e).

This method returns a view of the mapped elements. As long as the returned dart-core.Iterable is not iterated over, the supplied function image/image.Animation.map.f will not be invoked. The transformed elements will not be cached. Iterating multiple times over the the returned dart-core.Iterable will invoke the supplied function image/image.Animation.map.f multiple times on the same element.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
image/image.Animation.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to image/image.Animation.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If image/image.Animation.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of image/image.Animation.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

reduce.name: reduce
reduce.comment:
Reduces a collection to a single value by iteratively combining elements of the collection using the provided function.

Example of calculating the sum of an iterable:

iterable.reduce((value, element) => value + element);

singleWhere.name: singleWhere
singleWhere.comment: Returns the single element that satisfies image/image.Animation.singleWhere.test. If no or more than one element match then a dart-core.StateError is thrown.

skip.name: skip
skip.comment:
Returns an Iterable that skips the first image/image.Animation.skip.n elements.

If this has fewer than image/image.Animation.skip.n elements, then the resulting Iterable is empty.

It is an error if image/image.Animation.skip.n is negative.

skipWhile.name: skipWhile
skipWhile.comment:
Returns an Iterable that skips elements while image/image.Animation.skipWhile.test is satisfied.

The filtering happens lazily. Every new Iterator of the returned Iterable iterates over all elements of this.

As long as the iterator's elements satisfy image/image.Animation.skipWhile.test they are discarded. Once an element does not satisfy the image/image.Animation.skipWhile.test the iterator stops testing and uses every later element unconditionally. That is, the elements of the returned Iterable are the elements of this starting from the first element that does not satisfy image/image.Animation.skipWhile.test.

take.name: take
take.comment:
Returns an dart-core.Iterable with at most image/image.Animation.take.n elements.

The returned dart-core.Iterable may contain fewer than image/image.Animation.take.n elements, if this contains fewer than image/image.Animation.take.n elements.

It is an error if image/image.Animation.take.n is negative.

takeWhile.name: takeWhile
takeWhile.comment:
Returns an Iterable that stops once image/image.Animation.takeWhile.test is not satisfied anymore.

The filtering happens lazily. Every new Iterator of the returned Iterable starts iterating over the elements of this.

When the iterator encounters an element e that does not satisfy image/image.Animation.takeWhile.test, it discards e and moves into the finished state. That is, it does not get or provide any more elements.

toList.name: toList
toList.comment:
Creates a dart-core.List containing the elements of this dart-core.Iterable.

The elements are in iteration order. The list is fixed-length if image/image.Animation.toList.growable is false.

toSet.name: toSet
toSet.comment: Creates a dart-core.Set containing the elements of this dart-core.Iterable.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment:
Returns a string representation of (some of) the elements of this.

Elements are represented by their own toString results.

The representation always contains the first three elements. If there are less than a hundred elements in the iterable, it also contains the last two elements.

If the resulting string isn't above 80 characters, more elements are included from the start of the iterable.

The conversion may omit calling toString on some elements if they are known to now occur in the output, and it may stop iterating after a hundred elements.

where.name: where
where.comment:
Returns a lazy dart-core.Iterable with all elements that satisfy the predicate test.

This method returns a view of the mapped elements. As long as the returned dart-core.Iterable is not iterated over, the supplied function test will not be invoked. Iterating will not cache results, and thus iterating multiple times over the returned dart-core.Iterable will invoke the supplied function test multiple times on the same element.
